alert.note: Alert for Inland Southern Brevard; Mainland Southern Brevard; Orange; Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 8:41PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Brevard, southwestern Orange and Osceola Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 841 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Horizon West to 8 miles south of Saint Cloud to Viera. Movement was south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Palm Bay, Melbourne, Kissimmee, Saint Cloud and Rockledge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
